title: Spec object has no attribute cppflags - openblas fails to build
body:
@davydden mentioned that this a regression and that it worked a couple of days ago in #3333 .

I see the following (taking ```0.2.15``` because it isn't installed yet)

```
spack install openblas@0.2.15
==> Installing openblas
==> Fetching http://github.com/xianyi/OpenBLAS/archive/v0.2.15.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /scratch/wv385/Documents/git/spack/var/spack/stage/openblas-0.2.15-zazopc3jb6345biluudxxx4qo4igdukz/v0.2.15.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /scratch/wv385/Documents/git/spack/var/spack/stage/openblas-0.2.15-zazopc3jb6345biluudxxx4qo4igdukz
==> Building openblas [MakefilePackage]
==> Executing phase : 'edit'
==> Executing phase : 'build'
==> Executing phase : 'install'
==> Error: AttributeError: 'Spec' object has no attribute 'cppflags'
/scratch/wv385/Documents/git/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/openblas/package.py:143, in check_install:
     132      @run_after('install')
     133      def check_install(self):
     134          spec = self.spec
     135          # Openblas may pass its own test but still fail to compile Lapack
     136          # symbols. To make sure we get working Blas and Lapack, do a small
     137          # test.
     138          source_file = join_path(os.path.dirname(self.module.__file__),
     139                                  'test_cblas_dgemm.c')
     140          blessed_file = join_path(os.path.dirname(self.module.__file__),
     141                                   'test_cblas_dgemm.output')
     142  
  >> 143          include_flags = spec.cppflags
     144          link_flags = spec.libs.ld_flags
     145          if self.compiler.name == 'intel':
     146              link_flags += ' -lifcore'
     147          link_flags += ' -lpthread'
     148          if '+openmp' in spec:
     149              link_flags += ' ' + self.compiler.openmp_flag
     150  
     151          output = compile_c_and_execute(
     152              source_file, [include_flags], link_flags.split()
     153          )
     154          compare_output_file(output, blessed_file)

See build log for details:
```
